results.title: What's wrong with the sun?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at some of the observations which have caused a crisis in the study of our sun. Until recently it was thought to be a constant well-understood star. But now it is oscillating with frequent vibrations. This may mean a complete revision of our ideas about the inner temperature and composition of the sun and hence all other stars.

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: Colin Pym and SMS Audio Visual
results.brief_description: Australian Rules football is uniquely Australian. Six champion players demonstrate the basic skills and techniques of the game. Includes scenes from the 1977 grand finals in Victoria, South Australia and Western Australia. Features VFL football players Barry Cable, Russel Ebert, Bill Gallagher, Peter Knights, Graham Moss, Kevin Sheedy.

results.title: Tyrants will rise from my tomb
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Sweat of the sun, tears of the moon”.
The title of this episode is a quote from Simon Bolivar, the general who liberated South America from its Spanish conquerors over 150 years ago. Bolivar’s victory brought independence, but not necessarily freedom given the virtual epidemic of military dictatorships in South America since Bolivar. Writer and narrator, Jack Pizzey, visits two countries - Bolivia, named after Bolivar and Pinochet’s Chile - to discover why South Americans are prone to dictatorship and asks whether or not Bolivar’s nightmare of tyrants is fading.

results.title: Inca cola
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sweat of the sun, tears of the moon”.
In the sixteenth century, Spanish conquistador, Pissarro, and just 150 men overran the Peruvian Inca empire, an extremely well organised, productive empire stretching 3,000 miles, consisting of over 6 million people. Ultimately, the Spanish invasion resulted in the deaths of 80% of the Incas, with the remaining Incas condemned to serfdom under harsh Spanish landlords. Jack Pizzey visits Peru to discover what it means to be Inca today. In rural areas, he finds their descendants living and farming much as their ancestors had done, but in the cities, he finds a different story with slum-dwelling Indians aspiring to the wealth, possessions and careers of the modern world.
results.description:

Jack Pizzey visits Peru to discover what it means to be Inca today. In rural areas, he finds their descendants living and farming much as their ancestors had done, but in the cities, he finds a different story with slum-dwelling Indians aspiring to the wealth, possessions and careers of the modern world.

results.title: The Gambler
results.creator_credit: Karoly Makk, Marc Vlessing, Charles Cohen, Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat, Hungry Eye Lowland and Gambler Productions
results.brief_description: A British/Dutch/Hungarian co-production based on real-life events of Russian writer Fyodor Dostoyevsky and a dramatisation of his short novel, “The Gambler.” The film focuses on a period in the writer’s life at St Petersburg in 1866 when Dostoyevsky (Michael Gambon), aged 45, an obsessive roulette player whose consuming passion was forever landing him in debt, has an agreed deadline to complete a novel - or lose ownership of all his works to his rather unscrupulous publisher, Stellovsky (Thom Jansen). To help Dostoyevsky achieve this deadline, Anna (Jodhi May), an impoverished student desperate for money to help support her parents, is hired as his stenographer. But Anna finds to her dismay that this writer is not an easy person to work with. He is belligerent, cantankerous and condescending with no respect or sensitivity towards Anna’s feelings. However as the days go by, Anna finds herself inextricably caught up with Dostoyvesky’s imagination and the story he is creating - a tale of a young couple at the Casino in the fictional German resort Roulettenburg where the young man’s gambling obsession has put him into debt. The intertwining of reality and fiction eventually leads to a strange erotic attraction between Dostoyevsky and Anna. In real life, Anna Grigoryevna Snitkina became Dostoyvesky’s second wife and it is her written reminiscences that have allowed a glimpse into Dostoyevsky’s creative life and the eventual making of this film. Screenplay by Katharine Ogden, Charles Cohen and Nick Dear. Cast also includes Polly Walker, Dominic West, John Wood, Johan Leysen, Angeline Ball, Luise Rainer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karoly Makk, Marc Vlessing, Charles Cohen, Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat, Hungry Eye Lowland and Gambler Productions

To help Dostoyevsky achieve this deadline, Anna (Jodhi May), an impoverished student desperate for money to help support her parents, is hired as his stenographer. But Anna finds to her dismay that this writer is not an easy person to work with. He is belligerent, cantankerous and condescending with no respect or sensitivity towards Anna’s feelings. The intertwining of reality and fiction eventually leads to a strange erotic attraction between Dostoyevsky and Anna. In real life, Anna Grigoryevna Snitkina became Dostoyvesky’s second wife and it is her written reminiscences that have allowed a glimpse into Dostoyevsky’s creative life and the eventual making of this film. To help Dostoyevsky achieve this deadline, Anna (Jodhi May), an impoverished student desperate for money to help support her parents, is hired as his stenographer. But Anna finds to her dismay that this writer is not an easy person to work with. He is belligerent, cantankerous and condescending with no respect or sensitivity towards Anna’s feelings. However as the days go by, Anna finds herself inextricably caught up with Dostoyvesky’s imagination and the story he is creating - a tale of a young couple at the Casino in the fictional German resort Roulettenburg where the young man’s gambling obsession has put him into debt. results.title: The Victims
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
When the World War Two concentration camps closed, prisoners of war were returned and hostages released. But the victims of those camps continue to suffer - the assault on their minds has often been as effective as the assault on their bodies. More recently the victims of kidnappers have suffered in the same way. In this documentary, the victims discuss their ordeals.

results.title: Uranium goes critical
results.creator_credit: Richard Reisz and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
Discusses the role of uranium in the world’s energy situation. Maintains that at the present rate of use, uranium fuel could be used up in 20 to 30 years. Deals with the safety aspects of using uranium as a source of energy and asks if we should be looking at alternative technologies instead.
results.description:

results.title: Tracks on the Oregon trail
results.creator_credit: Christopher Riley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
Shows how strong government legislation has been largely responsible for the clean-up of Oregon’s rivers, roadside litter and air pollution problems.
Suitable for middle secondary level.
results.description:

results.title: The Galaxy in the sea
results.creator_credit: Klaus Jaritz, George Hart, Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A microscopic look at the Barrier Reef. Shows many of the 350 species of coral plus a variety of fish, sea slugs, and the fascinating Spanish Dancer.
